Learning Module

Models

Models for the Knowledge Learning application.

class learning.models.Certification(*args, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: Model

Certification model for theme completion.

Tracks certifications earned by users for completing all lessons in a theme.

exception DoesNotExist

Bases: ObjectDoesNotExist

exception MultipleObjectsReturned

Bases: MultipleObjectsReturned

certified_at

A wrapper for a deferred-loading field. When the value is read from this object the first time, the query is executed.

created_at

A wrapper for a deferred-loading field. When the value is read from this object the first time, the query is executed.

created_by

A wrapper for a deferred-loading field. When the value is read from this object the first time, the query is executed.

In the example:

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

Child.parent is a ForwardManyToOneDescriptor instance.

lesson_set

Accessor to the related objects manager on the reverse side of a many-to-one relation.

In the example:

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

Parent.children is a ReverseManyToOneDescriptor instance.

Most of the implementation is delegated to a dynamically defined manager class built by create_forward_many_to_many_manager() defined below.

class learning.models.Theme(*args, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: Model

Theme model for grouping cursus.

Represents a category or theme (e.g., Music, IT) that groups related cursus.

Most of the implementation is delegated to a dynamically defined manager class built by create_forward_many_to_many_manager() defined below.

class learning.models.Utilisateur(*args, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: AbstractUser

Custom user model with role and audit fields.

This model extends Django’s AbstractUser to include additional fields for user roles, account activation, and audit tracking.

exception DoesNotExist

Bases: ObjectDoesNotExist

exception MultipleObjectsReturned

get_role_display(*, field=<django.db.models.fields.CharField: role>)
groups

Accessor to the related objects manager on the forward and reverse sides of a many-to-many relation.

In the example:

class Pizza(Model):
    toppings = ManyToManyField(Topping, related_name='pizzas')

Pizza.toppings and Topping.pizzas are ManyToManyDescriptor instances.

Most of the implementation is delegated to a dynamically defined manager class built by create_forward_many_to_many_manager() defined below.

user_permissions

Accessor to the related objects manager on the forward and reverse sides of a many-to-many relation.

In the example:

class Pizza(Model):
    toppings = ManyToManyField(Topping, related_name='pizzas')

Pizza.toppings and Topping.pizzas are ManyToManyDescriptor instances.

Most of the implementation is delegated to a dynamically defined manager class built by create_forward_many_to_many_manager() defined below.

username

A wrapper for a deferred-loading field. When the value is read from this object the first time, the query is executed.

validation_set

Accessor to the related objects manager on the reverse side of a many-to-one relation.

In the example:

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

Parent.children is a ReverseManyToOneDescriptor instance.

Most of the implementation is delegated to a dynamically defined manager class built by create_forward_many_to_many_manager() defined below.

Views

Views for the Knowledge Learning application.

This module contains the views for handling user registration, authentication, purchases, lesson validation, and certifications.

learning.views.activate(request, uidb64, token)[source]

Activate user account via email link.

Verifies the activation token and activates the user account if valid.

Parameters:

  • request (HttpRequest) – The HTTP request object.

  • uidb64 (str) – Base64-encoded user ID.

  • token (str) – Activation token.

Returns:

Redirect to home or invalid activation page.

Return type:

HttpResponse

learning.views.buy_cursus(request, cursus_id)[source]

Handle the purchase of a cursus via Stripe.

Allows a user to purchase a cursus, redirecting to Stripe for payment.

Parameters:

  • request (HttpRequest) – The HTTP request object.

  • cursus_id (int) – The ID of the cursus to purchase.

Returns:

Redirect to Stripe or render the purchase page.

Return type:

HttpResponse

  • lesson_id (int) – The ID of the lesson to purchase.

Forms

Forms for the Knowledge Learning application.

This module contains forms for user registration.

class learning.forms.RegistrationForm(*args, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: UserCreationForm

Form for user registration with email.

Extends Django’s UserCreationForm to include an email field and custom save logic.

Tests

Unit tests for the Knowledge Learning application.

This module contains unit tests for user authentication, purchases, lesson validation, and data access components.

class learning.tests.AuthenticationTests(methodName='runTest')[source]

Bases: TestCase

Tests for user authentication functionality.

This class tests user registration, email activation, login, and logout.

setUp()[source]

Set up test data for authentication tests.

Creates a test user with an active account for use in tests.

test_login()[source]

Test user login with valid credentials.

Verifies that a user can log in and is authenticated after login.

test_logout()[source]

Test user logout functionality.

Verifies that a logged-in user can log out and is no longer authenticated.

test_user_email_activation()[source]

Test user account activation via email link.

Verifies that a user can activate their account using a valid email link.

test_user_registration()[source]

Test user registration and email activation requirement.

Verifies that a new user can register and that the account is inactive until email activation.

Bases: TestCase

Tests for data access components.

This class tests the creation of models in the database.

setUp()[source]

Set up test data for data access tests.

Creates a test user, theme, and cursus for data access tests.

test_create_certification()[source]

Test creation of a certification record.

Verifies that a certification record can be created for a user and theme.

test_create_cursus()[source]

Test creation of a cursus.

Verifies that a cursus can be created and associated with a theme.

test_create_lesson()[source]

Test creation of a lesson.

Verifies that a lesson can be created and associated with a cursus.

test_create_theme()[source]

Test creation of a theme.

Verifies that a theme can be created with the correct name.

test_create_validation()[source]

Test creation of a validation record.

Verifies that a validation record can be created for a user and lesson.

class learning.tests.PurchaseTests(methodName='runTest')[source]

Bases: TestCase

Tests for purchase functionality with Stripe.

This class tests purchasing lessons and cursus, including unauthorized access.

setUp()[source]

Set up test data for purchase tests.

Creates a test user, theme, cursus, and lesson for purchase-related tests.

test_buy_cursus()[source]

Test cursus purchase with Stripe redirection.

Verifies that a logged-in user can initiate a cursus purchase and is redirected to Stripe.

test_buy_lesson()[source]

Test lesson purchase with Stripe redirection.

Verifies that a logged-in user can initiate a lesson purchase and is redirected to Stripe.

test_buy_lesson_inactive_user()[source]

Test lesson purchase attempt by an inactive user.

Verifies that an inactive user cannot purchase a lesson and is redirected to home.

test_buy_lesson_unauthorized()[source]

Test lesson purchase attempt by an unauthorized user.

Verifies that an unauthenticated user is redirected to the login page.

class learning.tests.ValidationTests(methodName='runTest')[source]

Bases: TestCase

Tests for lesson validation and certification functionality.

This class tests the validation of lessons and the issuance of certifications.

setUp()[source]

Set up test data for validation tests.

Creates a test user, theme, cursus, and lessons for validation-related tests.

test_certification_after_validation()[source]

Test certification issuance after validating all lessons in a theme.

Verifies that a user earns a certification after validating all lessons in a theme.

test_no_certification_if_theme_not_complete()[source]

Test that no certification is issued if the theme is not fully completed.

Verifies that a certification is not issued until all lessons in a theme are validated.

test_validate_lesson()[source]

Test validation of a lesson by a user.

Verifies that a user can validate a lesson after marking it as completed.
